name: A Minor Revolution
description: A Minor Revolution combines influences from NOFX, Mad Caddies, Mischief Brew, and Sublime and have been a staple of the DIY punk scene in New Hampshire and Boston for the past 6 years. The band's style is self-described as a ADHD-Fueled mix of punk, rock and roll, and the darker side of ska with a little bit of weird to keep things interesting.

name: A Perfect Murder
description: While it can be argued that some cats indeed have nine lives, the same cannot always be said about metal and hardcore bands, with even the luckiest enjoying two but rarely more. Sprouting up nearly six years ago from the extreme music mecca of Canada and even North America at large, Montreal Quebec, A Perfect Murder beat the odds and are now on their third or fourth life at least. But time is still on their side; the band began recording when still in their teens, highlighting an early appetite for crafting heavy music not unlike legendary acts Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, Metallica, and Pantera did during their formative years.

name: Apes
description: No heaven, no hell, just pain, then death

name: Ariane Zita
description: Multi-instrumentiste douée – elle joue de la guitare, du piano et du violon –, cette diplômée en langues fait ses premiers pas sur les planches en 2010, dans le cadre du spectacle d’ouverture du Festival OFF de Québec.

name: Ate Bit
description: All our options were grow up, and prolong suffering.

name: Avenues
description: Avenues is a punk rock quartet from Milwaukee, Wisconsin which originally formed in January of 2006 by Vin Smith after parting way from 52Metro. After a few member changes, Avenues current lineup came together in 2009.

name: Barrasso
description: Formé officiellement en 2011, Barrasso accumule les compositions musicales au fil des années. Avec une attirance pour les groupes comme Hot Snakes, The Bronx et Hot Water Music, Barrasso y trouve rapidement son compte. Cependant, la fierté d’écrire en français s’impose.

name: Barricade
description: Après avoir participé à différents projets communs, dont Le Conflit, les gars ont laissé leur son évoluer vers les confins du post hardcore. Ils y ont ajouté leurs claires influences post rock pour obtenir une musique instrumentale plutôt planante mais aussi agressive à la fois.

name: Better Things
description: Better Things is an alternative-punk band from the city of Burlington, Vermont. Over the course of five years they have continued to evolve their music into what you hear today, an eclectic blend of punk music that gets any crowd singing along.

name: Big D And The Kids Table
description: Big D and the Kids Table front man David McWane has said, “There are people who want to be in a band and then there are musicians.” Once in a while a group comes along that makes music simply because they have no other choice – they are addicted musicians. For the past fifteen years Boston’s Big D And The Kids Table has proven just that, regardless of the band’s poverty. McWane describes the group as – “We’re modern American gypsies,” And you can feel that sense in their wildest record yet – For The Damned The Dumb & The Delirious

name: Bike Tuff
description: Hailing from the "farm belt" that rolls across Southern Michigan, we don't have an elaborate agenda for Bike Tuff. We have beards because we can't always afford razors, we play fast because half the dudes are from Jersey, and we love playing in basements because there's no stage for us to fall off of.

name: BOIDS
description: How do you define this made-up word? You define it as BOIDS; Montréal’s unstoppable punkrock juggernaut, channeling heartache, cosmic frustration and inspiration into a sweaty mess of pop-punk, thrash and old-school HC.

name: Bong Mountain
description: Somewhere there exists a dreary village at the base of a mighty mountain. The village is populated by people or elves or some shit, all of whom are totally miserable all the time, their lives are super boring. The mountain, for reasons no one knows, they call Bong Mountain.

name: Bottle Kids
description: Midwest Punk-We are driven by our influence of being under the influence. Crappy jobs, no money and singing out of key.

name: Brand New Lungs
description: Pop-punk/punk rock band from Montreal

name: Break Anchor
description: When Jay Navarro, the singer/frontman of the Suicide Machines and Hellmouth, finally hit bottom and came out of a haze of booze, pills, anger and depression, he had a fresh outlook. He wrote a song so full of melody and so full of angst, he felt he had found himself again. “A Failure Of Epic Proportions” is a song about the Midwest American experience of growing into adulthood.

name: Brutal Youth
description: Brutal Youth are like a loaded gun just, point us at whatever needs to die.

name: Bucky Harris
description: Bucky Harris is a band from Montreal, Quebec, playing a mixture of punk, rock and folk to create their distinct sound. They have toured Quebec and Ontario, and have had the pleasure of playing such festivals as Pouzza Fest, Rockaganza and Buckfest.

name: Colour Wheel
description: With an inability to shake nostalgia, Colour Wheel make songs that sound both old and new while remaining undeniably catchy throughout.

name: Condition Oakland
description: Condition Oakland started in late 2008/ Early 2009 as the Solo project of Tyler. Since then Condition Oakland has grown in to a full band. Standing by a strong code of D.I.Y. touring and ethics. In May 2015 the band released it newest e.p. titled “Nervous Ghost” on Digital Format for “Pay What You Want” Along with a CD & 7"inch.

name: Dead Weights
description: Dead Weights started in 2010 and has played a significant amount of local shows and basements since conception. A lot of beers have been drank. A lot of strings have been broken.

name: Dig It Up
description: Since 2008, Dig It Up has been turning strangers into best friends, dead cities into great adventures and created thousands of memories (some good, some not so good) of the shit show we like to call DIG IT UP.

name: Due North
description: Due North is a four piece, punk influenced, rock and roll band from Southeast Michigan

name: Elder Abuse
description: We've been in some bands before. Banned from Econo-Lodge world wide.

name: Escape Uken!
description: Five long time best friends making music together by passion and for fun with a common goal of making you move your feet and bang your head.

name: Five Minute Major
description: Acoustic/folk/punk band from Montreal, formed in 2013 by longtime friends Francis Morelli & Frank J. Leonard. In May 2014, they released a debut EP entitled "We Aren't Kids Enough" defining their unique sound of aggressive voices & catchy sing alongs. Early 2015, they hit Emery Street Studio as a trio with the addition of Justin Judd on bass guitar, to record "Black Sheep".

name: Flatfoot 56
description: Playing a positive-natured brand of hardcore-tinged Celtic punk, Flatfoot 56 has been unleashing itself upon America and the rest of the world for over 10 years now. Forming in 2000, the Chicago natives achieved nationwide attention with their first two label-backed records, 2006’s Knuckles Up and 2007’s Jungle of the Midwest Sea. These releases built on a heavy dose of previously established regional notoriety, helping the band gain steam early on.

name: Frank & Earnest
description: "None of us like playing music, we just like to hang out and drink. Well, Horky likes playing music, but that's not why he's in this band... he's just looking to get out of the house once in a while." - Otis

name: Fucko
description: two babes and a hunk

name: Full Of Hell
description: Harsh grinding death from the east coast. Numb your mind.

name: Get Dead
description: "We were supposed to have band practice but instead we hollowed out a bunch of pineapples and put gin inside of them; it got sticky and since then we've just been Get Dead,"

name: Half Truth
description: We play punk hardcore music in a ill-lit environnement.

name: Head Down
description: Three piece socially charged skate / pop punk from the true north of Ontario.

name: In The Meantime
description: In The Meantime formed when two veteran bands from Boston's Northshore punk scene, The Munchies and Local Tough Guy, fell victim to growing up and various quarter life crises. Those who had either survived or resisted the transition to adulthood decided to start a new band that would play a brand of melodic punk rock that would reflect that transition: mature enough in lyrics and technical enough in style to support your questionable claims of adulthood, yet melodic and catchy enough to satiate your hidden Blink 182 loving inner child.

name: Insubordination
description: Scott, Christian and Bryan of INSUBORDINATION bring together the punk sensibilities of NOFX, The Ramones, The Dead Milkmen, and Husker DU, mixed up with their own brand of youthful angst and wry sense of humor. Bringing back to punk what has been taken away in more recent years as punk became more mainstream. Extremely catchy riffs thought provoking lyrics added in with some anthem style gang vocals, produces a great mix of songs that are sure to become PUNK ANTHEMS!

name: Jabber
description: Melody driven pop punk from ex-members of Dead Ringer and The Pillowfights!

name: Jenn Fiorentino
description: Despite an innate love for singing and lyricism, her formative years consisted mostly of athletic pursuits, rather than artistic. Although her earliest musical tastes failed to inspire her own musical endeavors, that quickly changed when a few chance lyrics led her to the hallowed sounds of Social Distortion and Minor Threat.

name: Jesse Lebourdais
description: "Hardcore guys sing folk songs all the time, but no one belts them out like LeBourdais. No one can capture the honesty, the raw emotion quite the way he can. These aren't your average sing-along songs, but you'll find yourself singing along anyway." — CBC Music

name: Jonathan Becker
description: Scrapping and yelling. Mixing it up. Loving every minute with this damn crew.

name: Julius Sumner Miller
description: Because sometimes you just say fuck it. Sometimes a bunch of musicians can just hang out, drink beer and play good punk rock with their friends because it fucking rules. What comes after that is all icing on the cake. In a world bursting with whitewash garbage, gimmicks, and branding, Julius Sumner Miller delivers the straight goods. With no one to impress and nothing to apologize for this Calgary Punk Rock crew plays fast, hard and devoid of bullshit. Drawing inspiration and a name from the badass life of Julius Sumner Miller (remember the crazy professor on “The Hilarious House of Frightenstein”) JSM embodies the alternative, DIY persona. Having been recruited by friendship, and sharing a common love of fast riffs and cheap beer JSM is set to lay waste to all those who oppose the healing power of punk rock. 2014 is the year of the JSM. Steady yourself.

name: Junior Battles
description: Junior Battles like the following: ‘90s CanRock, the Back to the Future trilogy, old pop-punk, The Wire, post-hardcore, and the works of Mike Judge. Rally is their second full-length and best attempt to assimilate all their interests into one listenable place.

name: Kittyhawk
description: Chicago four-piece Kittyhawk play the sort of wry, dryly sweet pop songs that call to mind early 2000s bands such as Rainer Maria and The Anniversary. Trading bass guitar for a Farfiza organ, the band is anchored by the charming vocals of singer Kate Grube, whose narrative lyrics push their songs forward, inviting listeners to lean in a little closer. After the release of several split releases and a self-titled EP, the band is ready to release their debut full-length Hello, Again on Count Your Lucky Stars Records on October 14, 2014. Pre-order is now available via the Count Your Lucky Stars online store.

name: La Armada
description: During the early and mid-2000′s La Armada established themselves as one of the most influential bands in the Hardcore/Punk scene in their native Dominican Republic where they played countless shows and notched 2 releases under their belt. In 2007, after making a tough but groundbreaking decision to leave a land where even DIY culture is a commodity and very limited platforms existed to present their music, the band decided to relocate to Chicago.

name: La Querelle
description: The band built an epic post-rock with a building, driving rhythm section. The songs are sung with the heartfelt, poignant lyricism of classic ‘90s emo bands like Elliott and Sunny Day Real Estate. With three guitarists each adding their own distinct instrumental voice to the band’s richly textured songs retain a sonic richness that isn’t studio trickery; it’s the honest, unaffected sound of a group of friends cranking up the decibels and playing as fiercely as they can.

name: Late Night Munchies
description: Des cuivrettes qui pèttent et de la disto sale, des riffs reggae et swing, du bon vieux punk rock et du ska toutes générations confondues, en autant que ça lève!

name: Les Breastfeeders
description: Since 1999, Les Breastfeeders have been mostly known for their explosive performances. This Montreal-based rock monster has proved that rock’n’roll is still up and alive, charming critics and public alike with their albums Déjeuner sur l’herbe (2004), Les matins de grands soirs (2006), which was also released in France and most recently with their album Dans la gueule des jours (2011).

name: Les Happycuriens
description: Les Happycuriens, c’est un impressionnant groupe québécois de ska 100% francophone. En effet, en jumelant des mélodies très accrocheuses à des textes autant absurdes que lucides, le groupe lanaudois propose une musique festive dégageant un rafraichissant sentiment de bonheur et de joie de vivre. Concocté à partir d’influences reggae, jazz, rock et populaire, le mélange musical peut facilement rappeler des groupes comme Les Colocs, Yelo Molo et The Planet Smashers.

name: Less Than Jake
description: Playing music is about moments. A collection of great moments defines an amazing record. An avalanche of powerful moments tumbles into an engaging live show. The moment when band and fan become one and the same, the moment of interaction, is the type of moment that lasts forever.

name: Loss Aversion
description: Loss aversion refers to the tendency for people to strongly prefer avoiding losses than acquiring gains. Some studies suggest that losses are as much as twice as psychologically powerful as gains.

name: Lost Love
description: Lost Love is a young melodic pop-punk four-piece from Montreal. Formed in 2013, the band has toured relentlessly through Canada and the USA. They’ve shared the stage with some seriously awesome bands like Masked Intruder, Teenage Bottlerocket, PUP, The Ataris, Jeff Rosenstock, Make Do And Mend, DeeCracks and The Queers.

name: Merauder
description: If the music of New York City is any indication of what’s ingrained in the hearts of its people, Brooklyn’s own MERAUDER epitomizes the underbelly of inner-city America at its grittiest and most fearless. While rebellion-hungry suburbanites and wannabe gangstas fall victim to current trends and faux tough posturing, the true warrior spirit that is MERAUDER remains the genuine article after nearly two decades.

name: Molly Rhythm
description: A theatrical, eclectic, goofy, entertaining, and loud rock band fronted by two female vocalists with catchy melodies and badass riffs

name: Morgan
description: Morgan, groupe de 4 musiciens originaires de la ville de Valleyfield située dans le sud-ouest du Québec, présente un style unique de musique hybride alliant le Country et le punk, tout en flirtant avec les rythmiques Bluegrass Sud-Américaines ainsi que les ''Irish drinking songs'' traditionnelles. Pour simplifier la chose, leur style a été baptisé ''Punk Agricole'' ou ''Cow Punk''.

name: Murderburgers
description: Pop-punk band from Scotland. Songs about being flat broke and going mental. Most unhappy when not on tour. Most mentally unstable when on tour.

name: Neck
description: NECK are a punk-pop gang currently hiding out at Cretin Manner located in Lebreton Flats, Ontario. 'Hate to Read' is a jam packed debut featuring 24 unrelenting rippers. Less books ... More hooks! Gertrude Riddlesforth from The Nationally Educated Critics of Kanata describes the effort as 'the best book you'll never have to read'

name: Night Birds
description: Nights Birds is comprised of four thoroughly modern morons from the NJ shore and Brooklyn, NY. When not creating the surfy, punk rock din they're oh so infamous for, they enjoy watching shitty movies, discussing where to get the best pizza, eating pizza, and laughing at the misfortunes of others.

name: Ninjas N Aliens
description: We're armed and ready. We're Ninja family. We fight the Aliens within the confines of this very planet.

name: OC-45
description: Since it's inception in the summer of 2011, OC45 has played over 350 shows and spent approximately 43 weeks on the road, spanning six different DIY tours throughout North America. In Septmeber 2013, the band released it's debut EP, "When It Hits", on it's own label, BirdsEye Records. March 2015's follow-up release, "Burn It", was also released on BirdsEye, this time with the help of Boise's 1332 Records. With sights set on Europe in 2016 and a full-length in 2017, OC45 is showing absolutely no signs of slowing down.

name: On The Cinder
description: On The Cinder is a 3-piece punk rock band based out of Buffalo, NY. With everything from melodic harmonies, to ripping guitar and bass leads, to guttural screams, and a collection of influences that range from the Descendents to A Wilhelm Scream, they tread the line between punk rock and melodic hardcore. Their first full-length album, “The Fight Against Ourselves” will be released in April of 2016 on Between the Days Records, with a 2-month tour to follow. The tour includes dates date across the eastern half of the US, and a handful of Canadian dates including Pouzza Fest in Montreal.

name: One Flight Down
description: Songs about ex-girlfriends with guitars and some other stuff.

name: Pale Lips
description: Drippy mascara slopped rock n roll with sprinkles!

name: Peace Be Still
description: Nice and interesting, and all the other things girls say about guys they don't really like.

name: Pkew Pkew Pkew
description: And to think it all started with a Craigslist ad. Mike Warne (vocals, guitar) posted a call for band auditions, and only one person responded; a lone musician performing in a TV theme song cover band who played a mean version of the Pokemon intro. Naturally, Mike had to have him over to audition. His first meeting with Ryan McKinley (guitar, vocals) turned into a night of drinking cheap bottles of wine on Mike’s roof, and not playing any music. As the newfound friendship blossomed over a love of drinking and anime, the band began to take shape. Soon after came Emmett O'Reilly (bass and vocals) and Dave Laino (drums and vocals) who also fit the bill.

name: PL Mafia
description: Ensemble depuis 2003, PL Mafia est un groupe ska-punk francophone de Montréal. Avec ses prestations festives, le groupe s’est rapidement fait connaître sur la scène alternative québécoise par sa passion, son acharnement et l’énergie brute de ses spectacles. Le groupe s’est produit en concert plus de 150 fois avec plusieurs grandes têtes d’affiches (The Suicide Machines, Streetlight Manifesto, Big D and the Kids table, etc.) et ce dans 3 pays différents. Ils reviennent tout juste d’une tournée estivale en France, qui fut d’ailleurs un franc succès!

name: Rebuilder
description: Rebuilder is a Gnarly Punk band from Boston.

name: Red Arms
description: London, Ontario’s Red Arms like their rock loud, fast, and catchy. The noisy post-punk fueled guitar hooks and fill heavy drums, kick out the jams in a distortion-heavy wall of sound, mining the likes of all your favorite SST, Merge, Touch and Go, and Matador records in the process. The band released their first EP digitally in the fall of 2013 which gained the attention of CBC’s Grant Lawrence and led to the regular airplay of the single, Down To Sound. They released the EP on CD and cassette in early 2015 via the indie cassette-only/promotion label, Curt Murder Fan Club. A scorching new 7" will released on Yeah Right! Records in March 2016.

name: Red Mass
description: The variable artists involved create a diverse and profound array of images, sounds and planes of existence. While being created and held together by, Roy 'Choyce' Vucino, the band has been ever evolving and constantly in progress since it's beginning point. The project is now also affiliated with the music collectives the Seventh Order of Chaos & Brakhage. Drawing on roots music, punk, rock'n'roll, metal, folk, pop and experimental threads... Red Mass has an illusion for all.

name: Ringworm
description: Cleveland’s legendary kings of metallic hardcore return with their Relapse debut Hammer Of The Witch. 13 songs of fire-y rage propelled by lead vocalist Human Furnace’s wrathful fury, this is a record sure to satisfy metalheads and hardcore kids alike. Riffs and grooves collide on songs like ‘Psychic Vampires’ and ‘Bleed’ creating some of the most vicious hooks to get stuck in your brain in a long, long time. Hammer Of The Witch might just be the finest moment in Ringworm’s 20+ year career.

name: Rusty Feather
description: Montreal's band inspired by west coast punk rock from the era when some of us were just toddlers while others hadn't even been born.

name: Save Ends
description: A minute or so into "PunkORama 30", the opening song on Warm Hearts, Cold Hands, Save Ends slugs their listeners in the face with a circle pit-worthy charge into the first verse of their first full-length.

name: School Damage
description: School Damage’s gritty but melodic style of punk rock is a mix of raw hardcore energy and Ramones- four chords worship. The songs start and stop on a dime while dripping enough piss and vinegar to leave you dehydrated and thirsty for more.

name: Seth Anderson
description: Seth Anderson, The Renegade Kid, has been steadily building a Canadian music career from the ground up for over four years. Applying his blue collar work ethic to his music, of which he is most recognized for his catchy, truth laden, heart driven lyrics. “Anderson grabs your attention with a pure, honest, heartfelt sound that jumps out at you from the first note and stays with you long after you've stopped listening.” (Mike Gowing, Gray Dog Productions, Montreal, PQ).

name: Sick of it All
description: Living legends are revered for good reason. They are proof of an ideal. They are roots from which future generations grow. When New York city leading lights sick of it all formed in 1986, they had no idea they’d be here today, continuing to release spirited, revolution-calling hardcore.

name: Sink Or Swim
description: We started practicing in September of 2012 and began playing shows by January 2013, releasing a CD EP that summer and a new demo in the fall. Due to drummer issues and problems with the Canadian border, we played unplugged at Pouzza Fest in Montreal, QC in May 2014, calling it quits shortly after that. Recently, we've found a new drummer and are hoping to get ourselves off the ground for 2015. Stay tuned...

name: Sketchy
description: Once upon a time, Chris ran away from home and hid from the sun on Cape Cod. A bunch of people were like..."What the hell, man?" He came back to NY about a year later and went to a Pandemics show, where he met Vizzi and asked if he knew anyone who wanted to start a band. He sent over some demos and let Vizzi do the rest of the work. Pretty typical move for Chris.

name: Stereomonroe
description: Stéréomonroe c'est 15ans de fidélité au punkrock, à l'amour la vérité la famille les ami(e)s et à l'espoir malgré tout.

name: Stuck Out Here
description: party angst anthems

name: Swinging Flaws
description: Alt-rock band from Montreal, inspired by the rock of the 90's and the indie pop of today. A sweet mix of soft vocals and rough guitars.

name: Talk Show Host
description: Two recovering punks and an indie rocker walk into a bar.

name: Teenage Halloween
description: We believe in community and seek to destroy bigotry. We also want everyone to have fun. We play upbeat music that you can dance to. Parties spring up wherever we play.

name: The Beatdown
description: They call it Northern Reggae…A one-hundred proof blend of raspy rocksteady, sizzling soul, surf swagger and punkrock pedigree shaken (not stirred) with a double shot of the roughest roots reggae your ears have ever tasted. Pour it into a highball glass over some ice-cold lyrics and you’ve got The Beatdown’s latest full-length offering “Walkin’ Proud”. Following hot on the heels of their acclaimed 2010 self-titled debut, “Walkin’ Proud” is an apologetic collection of thirteen hard driving, soulful bangers coming straight from the gut. The album was recorded almost entirely live off the floor, capturing the raw live energy, urgency and unmarred production that has made The Beatdown an established underground favorite with fans and newbies alike.

name: The Copyrights
description: If you're gonna read anything in this bio, at least get these few facts straight: 1) The Copyrights are from a small college town in downstate Illinois called Carbondale, and are by far the biggest thing to come out of those cornfields as they have toured internationally multiple times; 2) They just released a 3-song EP on Fat Wreck Chords called, No Knocks, which is just a teaser for their upcoming LP, Report, due out on Red Scare in August; and 3) they're one of the best, smartest bands making buzzy, anthemic pop-punk in 2014.

name: The Dewtons
description: "The Dewtons...the most violent pop-punk show you'll ever attend, short of the Ramones!" -Andy Stomper of Bad Assets.

name: The Dreadnoughts
description: One part roaring sea shanty, one part haunting folk melody, and a solid chaser of gut-crunching street punk:The Dreadnoughts are Vancouver's biggest, baddest, drunkest, punkest folk band.

name: The Filthy Radicals
description: We are the Filthy Radicals, We came to Fucking Party!!!! Lets Get Filthy...

name: The Fleshtones
description: Since 1976, THE FLESHTONES have been blending R&R and R&B, serving it across the globe with smiles, attitude, and sweat, & calling it SUPER ROCK!

name: The Hunters
description: 4 young passionate musicians. Thousands of miles across the globe. A lot of shitty shows, but many great ones. Blood, sweat & tears. Lots of promises & dreams. A couple drunken silly things. This is The Hunters. This is ART ELECTRIC.

name: The Lippies
description: The Lippies are a feminist pop-punk band from Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since coming together in August of 2014, the band has been making a lot of noise in the Midwest music scene with their self-released first EP and subsequent live shows. The music can be described as extremely catchy pop punk, with sing-a-long hooks, but don't let that fool you–this is a punk band that has you singing along with lyrics about the personal journey of a budding riot grrrl finding her place in today's world. Vocalist, Tonia Broucek, has spent time in the basement/DIY scene in the Midwest, building a fan base with just her ukelele and a message, and has now put together a full band around that message. Recently the band signed to punk label Red Scare Industries and released their first full length on March 4th 2016.

name: The Planet Smashers
description: Pure unadulterated party ska awesomeness served up hot with a large order of radical sauce on the side just for good measure.

name: The Putz
description: The Putz is a pop punk rock band from Indianapolis, IN. In June of 2010 The Putz released their first their first studio album, "Hole In One", which they recorded at the legendary Sonic Iguana with Philip Hill. The Putz spent the following years playing around the Midwest with bands like The Queers, Flamingo Nosebleed, Parasites, The Dopamines, The Leftovers, and The Dewtons, to name a few. In October of 2012 The Putz won the Punk Rock Night Award for Best Local Band. In 2012 The Putz released two EPs simultaneously, "Beach Bound", recorded with Joe Queer and Jim Tierney, and "The Party of the Century", recorded again at Sonic Iguana. Also in 2012, The Putz hit the studio to record their second full-length album, "Knock It Off." Currently, The Putz are working on the release of Knock It Off and preparing to return to the studio as soon as possible.

name: The Red Owls
description: Formed in early 2015 by ex-members and members of The Ataris, Nightmares for a Week, Anadivine and Hidden In Plain View. The Red Owls came together to record "Do You Feel Any Better?. This EP marks the beginning of their creative pursuit to capture the sounds that their collective influences left ringing in their ears while adding a healthy dose of new life to this nostalgic genre.

name: The Slow Death
description: The Slow Death was formed in 2007 by Stuart Prickett, Mandy Andresen and Gregg Williamson as a doom/death recording project. The first self titled cd was recorded and released in 2008 to good reviews. In 2010 Yonn Mclaughlin joined as drummer and the second album recordings began. 'II' was again, self released in April 2012. In November 2012 Dan Garcia and Brett Campbell joined the band, and writing of the 3rd album was completed, to be recorded soon.

name: The Snails
description: The Snails are an eclectic act whose work, though identifiable with definite genres, defies generalization. Having spent previous years exploring and writing in the style of mid-century Jamaican music (ska, rocksteady, reggae) the group now brings influences as various and distant from each other as American garage rock and rhythm ‘n’ blues to the forefront of their original sound. Their songs are lyrically poignant (“poetry dressed with tune”), their rhythms aggressive, and their performance electrifying. Catch the beat, and you’ll never be able to put it down.

name: The Stragglers
description: Punks with houses. We're fucking role models! Just to clarify, we are not role models but our girlfriends are and we bang them.

name: The Valveenus
description: The Valveenus formed in 2004, becoming more active over the years creating a unique folk-influenced punk rock sound . Over the years we've shared the stage with such bands as SNFU, The Real MacKenzies, Guttermouth, Old Man Markley, Cobra Skulls, Nothington, The Koffin Kats, Gob,The Swellers and many more great bands. If you're interested in playing or booking a show with us, contact Matt at mattracha@gmail.com

name: Trophy Lungs
description: Four intoxicated nerds playing mediocre music in between episodes of The X-Files.

name: Typesetter
description: Typesetter is a band from Chicago, IL. They are influenced by punk, indie rock, shoegaze and noise rock. Since 2012 the band has played 250+ shows in the US, Canada, and Europe. Their latest release, LP "Wild's End," came out in October 2014 on Black Numbers.

name: Up For Nothing
description: If you like 90's punk rock.... This!

name: Vulgar Deli
description: Deli veterans Franck O'Brains (Tailgunner, The Brains, Ripcordz) and Uncle Costa (Blood Sausage,Grim Skunk), along with Charly (Squalor), Davey (Von Rebels) , Troy Cockhard, (Rockhard), return from the proctologist with a brand new Faster and Louder mid-life-crisis hardcore attitude.

name: Wasted Potential
description: Born in the backrooms of London, ON - littered with pizza boxes and beer cans, OSAP loans and amp tubes is Wasted Potential. Made up of members from bands that no longer matter – but once held great promise the very make up of the bands past gives light to the name – a reality so many musicians face – to put everything in and getting nothing back. But that may have changed with this group of seasoned local heroes, going against the grain of their very own name – as a powerhouse mix of attitude, talent and a live show that envelopes the audience into the fold of the angst-y anxiety ridden world of front man Danny Kidd – usually wasted, these guys are doing anything but wasting their potential.

name: Wayne Kennedy
description: Wayne Kennedy has all the defiant passion and mad vocal energy you would hear with a punk band but performed by strumming the ever-loving-shit out of an acoustic guitar.

name: WD40
description: Tout a commencé en 1994… Ayant quitté Chicoutimi trois ans plus tôt pour conquérir le monde, il me vint l’envie de faire enfin la musique qui jouait dans ma tête depuis toujours. Tanné de jouer dans des groupes pas bons, je pris le contrôle de ma vie et, sans trop m’en rendre compte, je créai un monstre.

name: Wolf-Face
description: In high school Michael J. Wolf made some serious waves when Hollywood decided to steal his life story of being a small town basketball playing werewolf and put it on the silver screen. Nowadays, Michael has found his groove rocking a hard pumping and infectious brand of hairy punk rock with his pack-mates Rain Wolf, Good Wolf, and Wolf Fart.
